description: Since the mid 17th century, from Italian manifesto, from manifestare, from Latin manifestō (“to make public”). Doublet of manifest.

nouns.description: manifesto (plural manifestos or manifestoes or manifesti)

entries.meaning: A public declaration of principles, policies, or intentions, especially that of a political party.
examples: A creed is a manifesto of religious or spiritual beliefs.

verbs.description: manifesto (third-person singular simple present manifestos, present participle manifestoing, simple past and past participle manifestoed)
